section.title: Concept
section.para: An LDAP entry contains different attribute types with different syntaxes: objectClasses, names, passwords, images, etc. To handle the different data types Value Editors are used. Value Editors know how to edit a value .

The default Value Editor for an attibute is determined using the following procedure:
If a Value Editor for the attribute type is specified, this one is used.
If a Value Editor for the attribute's syntax is specified, this one is used.
If the attribute is binary according to its syntax, the Binary Editor is used.
If the attribute is string according to its syntax, the Text Editor is used.
The default Value Editor could be specified by attribute type or syntax in the Value Editors preferences
Another task of a Value Editor is to provide the displayed value for the Entry editor and Search Result editor. Especially binary data can't be displayed "as-is".

section.title: In-Place Text Editor
section.para: The In-Place Text Editor is the default editor for string values without line breaks.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: Values are displayed as stored in directory:

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: Values are edited directly within the entry editor or search result editor. To save the new value press Enter or click somewhere outside the edit field. To cancel the modification press Esc.

section.title: Text Editor
section.para: The Text Editor is the default editor for string values with line breaks.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: Values are displayed as stored in directory:

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: Values are edited in a dialog which provides a simple text area. To finish editing press OK to save the new value or Cancel to discard your modification.

section.title: Hex Editor
section.para: The Hex Editor is the default editor for binary values.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The displayed value "Binary Data" indicates that the value contains binary data, additional the size in bytes is shown.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: The Hex Editor dialog displays the binary data as hex. To create or modify a value load the binary data from a file using the Load data... button.

simplesect.title: Save value
simplesect.para: You could also save the current binary data to a file with the Save data... button.

section.title: Password Editor
section.para: The Password Editor is the default editor for passwords.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The real password isn't displayed but only the encryption method.

simplesect.title: Details
simplesect.para: In the Current Passord tab you see some details about the password.

The current password could also be verified. Enter the compare password into the Verify Password field. The Verify function compares the current password with the hashed value of the entered password. The Bind function binds to the directory using the DN of the current entry and the entered password.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: In the New Passord tab you can enter a new passord. Type in the password in the input field and select a hash (encryption) method. The preview field shows the resulting password.

section.title: Image Editor
section.para: The Image Editor is the default editor for images.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The image type, width, height and size in bytes is used as display value.

simplesect.title: Details
simplesect.para: In the Current Image tab you see the image and some details about it.
You could also save the current image to a file with the Save... button.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: In the New Image tab you can load a new image from a file using the Browse... button.

section.title: Object Class Editor
section.para: The Object Class Editor is the default editor for the objectClass attribute.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The objectClass name and the type of object class (structural, auxiliary, abstract) is used as display value.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: In the Object Class Editor dialog you can select the available object classes from a drop-down list.

section.title: Address Editor
section.para: The Address Editor is the default editor for attributes with postal address syntax. In the postal address syntax the dollar character '$' is used as line separator.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: Values are displayed as stored in directory, dollar characters are replaced by commas.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: Values are edited in a dialog which provides a simple text area. Dollar characters are replaced by line breaks.

section.title: DN Editor
section.para: The DN Editor is the default editor for attributes with distinguished name syntax.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: Values are displayed as stored in directory.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: The edit dialog looks as follows:

To edit the DN you can use the following options:
You could manually edit the DN in the input field.
You could choose a previously used DN from drop-down list.
By clicking
Parent the parent DN of the current DN appears in the input field.
Browse.. opens a DN Selector, similar to the LDAP Browser. You can browse and filter to find an entry. When selecting an entry its DN appears int the input field.

section.title: Date & Time Editor
section.para: The Date & Time Editor is the default editor for attributes with generalized time syntax.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The values are converted to local time.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: The edit dialog looks as follows:

To edit date and time you have the following options:
You could set the time, pick a date from the calendar and choose a time zone.
You could manually edit the raw value in the input field.

section.title: OID Editor
section.para: The OID Editor is the default editor for attributes with OID syntax.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The values are suffixed with the textual description of the OID.

simplesect.title: Edit value
simplesect.para: The In-Place Text Editor is used to edit values.

section.title: Certificate Editor
section.para: The Certificate Editor is the default editor for certificates.

simplesect.title: Display value
simplesect.para: The certificate type, version and owner are displayed.

simplesect.title: Certificate Editor Dialog
simplesect.para: The full certificate data could be exampined in the Certificate Editor dialog. Load data... button.
You could also save the current certificate to a file with the Save Certificate... button.
To modify the certificate in the directory server load the new certificate from a file using the Load Certificate... button and press the OK. button.
